net.dragondelve.customdriversutil.gui

Class DefineTracksStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dragondelve.customdriversutil.gui.DefineTracksStep
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StageController

    public class DefineTracksStep
extends java.lang.Object
implements StageController
    DefineTracksStep is an intermediate step between pressing the addTrackOverrideButton and the Driver Editor opening in the Override mode to allow the user to set all the tracks on which the newly created override will be overriding the base driver properties. This is a controller class for fxml/DefineTracksStep.fxml.

      • rootPane

        private javafx.scene.layout.VBox rootPane
        The root pane of the entire scene. Used to assign the css style to the controls and containers.

      • selectedListView

        private javafx.scene.control.ListView<Track> selectedListView
        ListView that displays the tracks selected by the user. Items of this list are going to be passed forward to the DriverEditor to edit the override for the chosen tracks

      • trackLibraryListView

        private javafx.scene.control.ListView<Track> trackLibraryListView
        ListView that displays all tracks in the current track library, minus the tracks that are already selected in the selectedListView

        private javafx.stage.Stage stage
        Stage on which this editor is displayed.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize method initializes all the visual elements before they are displayed by the user. initialize method is called automatically by JavaFX when this editor is being loaded from XML.

      • setTrackOverride

        public void setTrackOverride(TrackOverride trackOverride)
        Lightweight mutator method. Used when editing a trackOverride.
        Parameters:
        trackOverride - trackOverride that is being edited if this editor is performing the edit action

      • setStage

        public void setStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Lightweight mutator method. Should be called before the editor is initialized by JavaFX.
        Specified by:
        setStage in interface StageController
        Parameters:
        stage - stage on which this editor is going to be displayed.

      • cancelAction

        private void cancelAction()
        Action that is performed by the cancelButton. Closes this editor's Stage.

      • nextAction

        private void nextAction()
        Action that is performed by the nextButton. Opens a driver editor in a new window
